name: 1619_A. Square String?
description:
A string is called square if it is some string written twice in a row. For example, the strings "aa", "abcabc", "abab" and "baabaa" are square. But the strings "aaa", "abaaab" and "abcdabc" are not square.

For a given string s determine if it is square.

Input

The first line of input data contains an integer t (1 ≤ t ≤ 100) —the number of test cases.

This is followed by t lines, each containing a description of one test case. The given strings consist only of lowercase Latin letters and have lengths between 1 and 100 inclusive.

Output

For each test case, output on a separate line:

  * YES if the string in the corresponding test case is square, 
  * NO otherwise. 



You can output YES and NO in any case (for example, strings yEs, yes, Yes and YES will be recognized as a positive response).

Example

Input


10
a
aa
aaa
aaaa
abab
abcabc
abacaba
xxyy
xyyx
xyxy


Output


NO
YES
NO
YES
YES
YES
NO
NO
NO
YES

prompt:
A string is square if written twice consecutively, for example "aa", "abcabc", "abab" and "baabaa" are square while "aaa", "abaaab" and "abcdabc" are not square. For a given string s determine if it is square. Ensure that the solution is efficient even for strings of maximum allowed length.

Input

The first line of input data contains an integer t (1 ≤ t ≤ 100) —the number of test cases.

This is followed by t lines, each containing a description of one test case. The given strings consist only of lowercase Latin letters and have lengths between 1 and 100 inclusive.

Output

For each test case, output on a separate line:

  * YES if the string in the corresponding test case is square, 
  * NO otherwise. 



You can output YES and NO in any case (for example, strings yEs, yes, Yes and YES will be recognized as a positive response).

Example

Input


10
a
aa
aaa
aaaa
abab
abcabc
abacaba
xxyy
xyyx
xyxy


Output


NO
YES
NO
YES
YES
YES
NO
NO
NO
YES

A string is square if written twice consecutively, for example "aa", "abcabc", "abab" and "baabaa" are square while "aaa", "abaaab" and "abcdabc" are not square. For a given string s determine if it is square. Ensure that the solution is efficient even for strings of maximum allowed length.

Input

The first line of input data contains an integer t (1 ≤ t ≤ 100) —the number of test cases.

This is followed by t lines, each containing a description of one test case. The given strings consist only of lowercase Latin letters and have lengths between 1 and 100 inclusive.

Output

For each test case, output on a separate line:

  * YES if the string in the corresponding test case is square, 
  * NO otherwise. 



You can output YES and NO in any case (for example, strings yEs, yes, Yes and YES will be recognized as a positive response).

Important Note: You must follow the input output format. Input must be taken from standard input and output must be given to standard output. The code will be tested against multiple test cases and all the test cases must be passed.
Write a main() function and use input() function to read input from stdin

A string is considered square if when written twice consecutively, it forms a new string that is identical to the original string. For instance, "aa", "abcabc", "abab", and "baabaa" are examples of square strings, while "aaa", "abaaab", and "abcdabc" are not considered square. The task is to determine if a given string s is square, and the solution should be efficient enough to handle strings of the maximum allowed length.

Input

The first line of input data contains an integer t (1 ≤ t ≤ 100) —the number of test cases.

This is followed by t lines, each containing a description of one test case. The given strings consist only of lowercase Latin letters and have lengths between 1 and 100 inclusive.

Output

For each test case, output on a separate line:

  * YES if the string in the corresponding test case is square, 
  * NO otherwise. 



You can output YES and NO in any case (for example, strings yEs, yes, Yes and YES will be recognized as a positive response).

Example

Input


10
a
aa
aaa
aaaa
abab
abcabc
abacaba
xxyy
xyyx
xyxy


Output


NO
YES
NO
YES
YES
YES
NO
NO
NO
YES

-------
Important Note: You must follow the input output format. Input must be taken from standard input and output must be given to standard output. The code will be tested against multiple test cases and all the test cases must be passed.
Write a main() function and use input() function to read input from stdin

A string is considered square if it reads the same forwards and backwards when written twice consecutively, such as "aa", "abcabc", "abab", and "baabaa". The task is to determine if a given string s is square, ensuring the solution is efficient even for strings of the maximum allowed length.

Input

The first line of input data contains an integer t (1 ≤ t ≤ 100) —the number of test cases.

This is followed by t lines, each containing a description of one test case. The given strings consist only of lowercase Latin letters and have lengths between 1 and 100 inclusive.

Output

For each test case, output on a separate line:

  * YES if the string in the corresponding test case is square, 
  * NO otherwise. 



You can output YES and NO in any case (for example, strings yEs, yes, Yes and YES will be recognized as a positive response).

Example

Input


10
a
aa
aaa
aaaa
abab
abcabc
abacaba
xxyy
xyyx
xyxy


Output


NO
YES
NO
YES
YES
YES
NO
NO
NO
YES

Write a main() function and use input() function to read input from stdin

 # [core concept]
